summary: Email from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense counsel regarding proposed redactions to the Dietz/Loftus briefing and a court order, as directed by the court. The email includes an attachment with proposed redactions to Exhibit 2 of the defense's response.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding proposed redactions to legal briefing; appears to be defense counsel in the case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding proposed redactions to legal briefing; appears to be defense counsel in the case.

connections.description: Both are recipients of the email from the prosecutor regarding legal redactions, suggesting they are co-counsel or part of the same defense team.

events.title: Email on Dietz/Loftus Redactions
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney emails defense counsel to propose redactions to the Dietz/Loftus briefing and court order, as ordered by the court.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The court ordered the parties to docket and propose redactions to the Dietz/Loftus briefing and the court's order.
The prosecutor is only proposing redactions to Exhibit 2 of the defense's response.
The email is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel Christian Everdell and Laura Menninger.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings involving expert testimony or analysis from Dietz and Loftus.
The document shows procedural coordination between prosecution and defense regarding public filing redactions.
